result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean W Thornton

State's NOI to Introduce Certd Public Records
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

2:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sean W Thornton in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have counsel.
BTC: Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. Finding of good cause of waive time limits per defendants request to retain counsel . Defendant can appear via zoom at next date.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
